product_description.Premium Design: The POCO M3 features a textured back panel and a premium leather-like finish to offer an elegant look to this smartphone. Also, it has a side-mounted fingerprint sensor that adds a premium style and convenience.
product_description.Powerful Function: You can switch between your games and apps quickly and seamlessly, thanks to the 6 GB LPDDR4X RAM of this smartphone. Also, the UFS 2.1/2.2 storage solution further boosts the performance of POCO M3.
product_description.FHD+ Display: You can experience high-quality, clear, detailed, and rich visuals on the FHD+ Display of this smartphone. The true-to-life visuals on this display offer an immersive experience.
product_description.Battery Life: The POCO M3 comes with a massive battery that offers up to 672 hours of standby time. Also, the 18 W fast charging feature quickly boosts the battery life of this smartphone to ensure that your phone is always up and running.
product_description.Sharp Cameras: The 48 MP triple cameras (48 MP+2 MP +2 MP) of this smartphone come with various features, such as movie frame, time lapse, night mode, and color focus, to ensure that your photography skills impress everyone.

I am writing this review after using this mobile phone for 2 days . First of all, I would like to thanks POCO for manufacturing this wonderful phone.

Look : The design of the phone is quite attractive with a different back camera panel having a logo "poco" of the company. Body colour texture is excellent. It looks quite premium product. With a plastic back cover, there will be no fingerprint stick with your phone. Although, due to high capacity battery, you may feel little bit heavy on your hand while using this mobile. Looking wise, the product is quite similar to realme 3pro or realmi 7 phone. So nothing new. I shall give 4/5 in this part.

Display : The clarity of the picture is excellent, colour reproduction on screen is brilliant. I have been using realme phone for one year and this poco m3 is quite similar or even better from that phone. So I will give 5/5 for display.

Sound : With stereo speakers, the audio output of this mobile is extraordinary. I am very much satisfied. Watching movie or listening music is going to be a very pleasant experience for everyone who has got this phone. So 5/5 is here.

Speed and performance : I am a regular user of mobile phone. I don't play game to much. For normal user, speed and performance of this phone is just above average. Again I will give 5/5.

Battery : Powered with 6000 mah battery, it is quite massive and you can run your phone for a couple of days with a single charge. You can't ask any more. The battery will take around 2 hours to get full charge . It is quite acceptable time keeping in mind the 6000 mah size of the battery. Again 5/5 is here.

Sensors : Fingerprint sensor is mounted over power bottom and it works very well. The IR sensor is something bonus. It also works very well. The proximity sensor is also excellent. So I will be giving here 5/5 for sensors.

Camera : In my experience, this is a point where the phone required considerable improvement. The picture quality of front and rear camera is just average. Colour reproduction of the camera is not so good. Don't believe on 48 megapixel. This is just a number, I suppose. So 3/5 here.

User Interface : Powered with MIUI interface, you will feel very comfortable while operating with your phone. But there are some pre-installed softwares and games, which are quite unnecessary. So it should be cleaned. Again I will give 4.5/5 here.

Lastly, keeping in mind the price, this is the best budget phone available at present. I hope this review will be helpful for customers who want to have a clear idea about this poco m3 mobile phone.

Overall verdict, in this price range, this is the best phone and I will be happy to recommend this poco m3 mobile phone for every users,,,,,,,👍👍👍💚💚💚💚💚💯💯💯💯💯
Best phone in this price... Awesome camera,performance,display.... Camera work best in 48 mp .....

1) Delivery on time, Properly packed with bill copy

2) In the box POCO has Mobile (Tempered glass pre installed), Charger, Transparent case cover and Manual.

3) Out of the box, visually the phone looks appealing. Rear camera placement and design choice looks good on the phone.

4a) To touch and feel, the rear of the phone feels more like plastic but at the same time it also feels rigid and non slippery cause of the design texture the material offers.

4b) For a big battery it carries, it doesn't look or feel very heavy.

5) Side mount finger print sensor/lock button. Well though out and rightly placed.

6) The device boots faster than QC SD665 device. Android 10 along with 6GB ram makes it smooth and agile, Storage option of 128GB is preferably better considering MIUI pre installed apps take up some space.

7) Smooth FHD Display worth the money. Phone offers additional display options like more warmth / cool / colour saturation as well.

8) Experiencing fast charging 1st hand. Battery charging and backup is Overwhelming! Yet to put through rigorous games.

9) Camera is average. Auto white balance is poor. Exposure is always on the bright side. Needs manual tweeking.

10) Stereo speakers are better than most other phones. Not crisp though.

11) For stock android users this MIUI may not be the best UI experience. Can be customised to personal preference.

12) Privacy wise MI pre installed apps allow most permission as default and disabling app permissions selectively is a time consuming job. Not all of them can be uninstalled.

Have to see how it handles with time.

Final verdict, this phone is an all-rounder, it has some down's but it make it up by it's stronger part's. For this price this phone is value for money. However,there is other phone's in the market with some extra specs ; if you can push your budget further then go for it otherwise you can choose this phone you won't disappoint.

I received my Poco M3 today (delivered by Ekart in 2 days). These are my first impressions.

Design and build: Fits well in hand and it's side mounted finger print scanners ls also placed in an optimal location. A simple plastic back with curved edges. Feels little heavy.

Display: Looks stunning with great colours and balanced and adaptive brightness. It's Full HD+ display is Ideal for watching videos. 60Hz refresh rate is good considering the budget but as I shifted from high end one plus, I felt it little slow.

Battery: It seems to be decent (I have used it for 3 hours heavily and it is down by 25%). Charging takes little longer time, maybe because of high capacity battery.

Camera: It is an average camera (satisfied for price range but don't fall for the numbers or pixels). Performs well under bright light and average under low light. Front camera is below average. So there might be phones clicking better photos in this price range.

Speaker: This is where Poco M3 beats all it's competitors, thanks to it's dual stereo speakers which steals the show. Undoubtedly best in the segment. (If you don't compare with high end phones)

Performance: 6gb ram ans Snapdragon 662 sounds fine for this budget section and it performs decently. Cannot expect a heavy performance from a budget smartphone.

Storage: Comes with so many pre installed apps and games, but fortunately they can be uninstalled so 64gb varient is handy and 128gb is anyways a better varient with a higher speed.

UI : It is typical MIUI, so if you have used MI phones it won't be confusing but the ones switching from other company phones might take a little time for getting used to it. Many Mi apps are also installed. It doesn't seem to be ads free though.

Overal Verdict: The phone is well balanced in all areas. If you want to use it mainly for watching videos or movies then go for it without a thought. Battery is good and performance is decent. If you are a camera enthusiast, then better find other alternatives.

That's all for few hours of usage. Hope you find it helpful!

Writing after using for 10 days.

-Comes with high quality silicone case inbox, its perfect, tight fitting and has a neat flip on cover for charging port (POCO M2 does not come with case).
-22.5 charger is fast but also heavy & bulky (Mi 18 watt charger is much sleeker & lighter).
-Battery life from its 6,000 mAh is great. Supports reverse charging but strangely we still get impure USB C cable & USB A charger, so one needs to buy & carry a pure USB C cable seperately.
-Phone has good decent width of 77mm making it quiet comfortable to hold and use.
-Display at 1080 is decent, sunlight usage feels a tab better than M2, however it's brightness nits at 400 is the same, for good direct sunlight visibility look for ph of higher nits.
-Stereo speaker is sort of Ok. Infact M2 despite having solo speaker seemed better sounding.
-Cameras: not a fan of taking pictures, so unable to comment.
-Side finger print scanner takes some getting used to, the sensor scanning area (power button) is small compared to rear sensor of M2, so sometimes have to touch multiple times for it to recognise & also seems to take a fraction longer in comparison.
-Phone is quiet responsive and quick overall to load apps, data files etc. Probably due to high speed UFS 2.2 ROM (128GB) and 6 GB RAM.

As seems to be the case with a number of phones these days, it lacks LED notification light (ditto with M2). So one to has double tap & wake up ph every now and then to check for notification, Hope that manufacturers introduce it back on all forthcoming phs and make it a standard feature, this is probably more useful than IR blaster considering all modern TV, Audio etc have Bluetooth remotes and don't work on IR.
Originally Purchased M3 with the plan to sell off M2, but after using for 10 days, ended up selling M3 on OLX for 1k less than purchased price and went back to my earlier ph POCO M2, mainly due to its convenient & faster rear fingerprint sensor, auto call record feature & slightly better audio.

Still POCO M3 is a great ph offering fantastic value.

I am writing review after using phone for approximately 20 days. I am not a big game lover, so haven't played games on this device but performance wise there phone is excellent.

Pros:

- Excellent screen size and resolution. Good to read ebooks, watching videos.
- Plenty of useful modes such as reading mode, black and white mode, normal and ultra bettery saver mode which can save a lot of battery in case of traveling.
- Best performance in normal use like watching YouTube video and Netflix.
- Amazing battery. Lasts 48 hours for continuous usage.
- Quick charging. It takes around 3 hours for phone to charge from 1% to 100%.
- I was worried about bloatware since it's MIUI, but there are very few number of pre-installed apps which comes in phone which we can't uninstall, so we have to disable them when we don't need them.
- Phone provides excellent options to manage background running apps.


Cons:
- Camera quality is below average. Low light (Indoor) photos are not that good.
- Front camera is average, sufficient for video calling but not as per expectation for low light selfies.
- of you're not using phone cover, phones body is bit slippery.

But these cons are manageable since it's 12k phone we can't expect everything.

After few months of use I'm pretty confident on my opinion of what type of a smartphone this POCO M3 is. I have got the 6/64 GB variant so some of what I say will be viable for that variant only as with a less amount of ram the experience will be a little different but shouldn't be drastic. 1st and foremost the skin-MIUI for POCO although an improvement from the regular MIUI found in Xiaomi's other brands, it's still buggy and resource intensive. The simple fact that the "control centre" looks like Apple's and it's seperate from notifications is a far cry from what Google is doing with their take on Android and stock Android itself as well as most of other skins from other manufacturers operating in this country. Yes it is possible to change it back to old style but it's called 'old 'why would I want that in my new phone? According to my opinion, a User Interface is what a user interacts with, so it's stability and smoothness should be the topmost priority for a company but with increasingly competitive cost cutting and the smartphone landscape in India, smartphone companies neglect this very critical part, as evident from Xiaomi's attempt in this smartphone. But there's a saving grace for this smartphone that if you are comfortable and willing to risk your warranty, the bootloader can be unlocked easily and you can install a large variety of OSs or Skins. On a final note about the MIUI, the update situation is also lacking and regular security patches and updates is a no show (but to be fair most of the companies are like that too). Talking about the performance, the combination of Qualcomm Snapdragon's 662 SoC and 6 GB if ram makes it a really good and capable handset. For most of regular use (if the UI isn't lagging) it's a breeze to use. Some form of smartphone gaming is actually possible with this, but I am not a mobile gamer so I haven't actually explored that front myself. Now changing my attention to the build and feeling of the handset, I would say it's pretty decent. I mean it's plastic but it's got it's advantages and disadvantaged as all the things in life do! The plastic doesn't feel squeaky and cheap. The only thing is the black variant (which I have) has a giant logo at the back. Now I understand it's a technique for the brand to stand out in this crowded Indian market, the logo and brandings on the yellow variant makes it appealing, but people generally buy the black variant to not do that. The side mounted fingure print sensor is fast and accurate, you shouldn't even need to look at your device before it's opened as you reach the power button and your thumb gets scanned in the scanner. The USB type C port present is a USB 2 variant not the newer USB 3 so the transfer speeds are slow, so patience is required if transferring large files over the USB. The display and the speakers are also very good but not exceptional as I hoped! The speaker although being a stereo, has unbalanced sound from the top (earpiece) and bottom speaker, but the volume is pretty loud, with little pops and crackles when heard at max volumes in some songs. The headphone jack present in this device is also very good, there's no electrical noise that I can hear, as well the output is very respectable. The volume buttons are good and clicky while the same cannot be said about the vibration motor Xiaomi has used. The motor is very weak and doesn't have good haptic feedback. Finally the best part of the smartphone is it's amazing cameras (only 2 worth talking about) and the battery life! The rear 48 MP f/1.8 wide camera is a joy to use in this price point. It produces good and vibrant image, although the saturation is a bit much, but I wouldn't complain about it. The front 8 MP f/2.1 is also pretty decent, while the automatically enabled face smoothening makes every photo an oil painting but once disabled takes very usable pictures. If a Google camera mod apk is installed and setup, that improves the camera much more than the stock app. The 6000 mAh battery has a terrific battery life, and the included 18W fast charger also does a very good job in topping up the battery when in a pinch, but I wouldn't count on it for absolute time crunch. Also this large battery is a confidence inspiring as it will last a longer time as it degrades with charge cycles. Finally this device is very good for the price it's demanding and keeping any brand loyalty aside (as you should) buying this device was a good decision I would say.

Before proceeding I would like to highlight few points.
Every seller on Flipkart has his own return & refund policies. Make sure to read it before you buy anything.

I bought this phone on 13th Sept 2021, and have been using the phone for a week.
Following are the issues faced

1. The phone gets overheated, I have previously used Samsung galaxies devices and never ever faced heating issues even after binge-watching Netflix.
However, I am facing these issues with this phone.
2. The phone gets heated even when charging
3. Camera quality is not good, I am fully aware that at this price I am not expecting a highly developed camera, but what I disliked about it is it has inbuilt filters that can be reset. I use video calls for my work-related things and nowadays I am not liking, as every video application uses this camera and due to filter, the face is highly weird.
4. UI is not good for me

I wanted to return and get a refund as I was not satisfied with the product, I was complaining about Flipkart from Saturday, & its services is very slow & not at all customer friendly.
Every time a new ticket is created and I had to explain the issues every time from scratch. This is not a good experience.
Flipkart arranged technician visits and NOTE Flipkart has its own parameters to return the product. My phone is getting heated up to 43 to 44 degrees, and according to Flipkart 48 degrees is the minimum temp to accept the product has a fault.

I kept complaining to Flipkart, but it doesn't matter as they will keep assigning you a technician and a 3rd visit was scheduled for me with the same results, now THE OFFICIAL 7 DAYS RETRUN bracket is finished and now I can't even raise the request for a return.
Flipkart is very poor when it comes to customer service

pros.6000 mAh Battery: The massive 6000 mAh battery is powerful to keep this device running for more than one day easily. The 18W fast charger ensures a quick charge to get the device up and running.
pros.FHD+ Display: The 16.59 cm (6.53 inch) Full HD+ Display gives excellent picture quality, clear and detailed visuals offering an immersive viewing experience.
pros.Design: This phone has an attractive and premium design.
pros.Performance: The octa core Qualcomm Snapdragon 662 is fast and can handle all the daily tasks smoothly and seamlessly.

cons.Camera: The triple rear camera setup and 8MP front camera gives just an average performance and is below par for this price range.

summary.verdict: The POCO M3 is an all rounder phone with some amazing features making it value for money product.
summary.Additional Information: Side mounted fingerprint, Screen recording, Supports freefire on ultra graphics.
